blog.title: Seize the Night!
blog.description:
Avid reader/writer. 
Prone to binge watching and non-stop talking about books/series. 
Can fall in love with simply one line of a book/song/movie.
Love the English language. 
Owner of a never-ending TBR and to be watched lists.

tags: a little crazy endeavour of mine
well a bit late now but I found this again in my drafts
summary: After taking it upon myself to read through all Sarah J. Maas books in chronological order (yes, I really did that – ask my...
body:
After taking it upon myself to read through all Sarah J. Maas books in chronological order (yes, I really did that – ask my friends they heard all the screaming) I am officially through both series again. And what a roller coaster that was.

With ToG I have to say that I forgot so many little things about the first two books that I loved. Some were pure fluff and others just grabbed me and tore my heart out – especially the scene in the Calaculla and the slave uprising there.

And HOLY SHIT I never noticed how many seemingly teeny, tiny things were already strewn throughout the books to set up all the major events. I loved it so much to go read all 5 books in one go and watch the story unfold and notice all those moments of foreshadowing and setting up of future events.

Just your friendly neighbourhood fandom blog! Current fandoms:

TOG, ACOTAR, The Grishaverse (Leigh Bardugo), MARVEL, GOT, Legend (Marie Lu) and many more!

Literally just a fan of fantasy and Sci-Fi (and YA-novels). Currently reading: Kingdom of Ash (SO. MUCH. PAIN.) & Luck in the Shadows

Thanks for checking by!

summary: Illyrian heart
body:
Illyrian heart

So, we know that birds need a heart twice the size of a humans (in proportion to their body volume) since flying takes a lot of energy and oxygen needs to be transported rapidly to the different parts of the birds body.

So while Tamlin’s heart is made of stone, Rhysands heart is literally twice as big. In conclusion, Rhys is full of love, and so is Cass and Az, thanks for coming to my TED-talk

blog.name: paper-ash-ink
blog.title: have high hopes
blog.description:
“the world will be saved and remade by the dreamers”

Masterlist

summary: 27 Quotes from Throne of Glass
body:
27 Quotes from Throne of Glass

A collection of underrated quotes from ToG that do not include stars, by @worldofsarahjmaas - book numbers included.

  1. “Libraries were full of ideas- perhaps the most dangerous and powerful of all weapons.” (#1)
  2. “I name you Elentiya, ‘Spirit That Could Not Be Broken.’” (#1)
  3. “Some thing you hear with your ears, others you hear with your heart.” (#2)
  4. “Perhaps the world would never be perfect, perhaps some things would never be right, but maybe she stood a chance of finding her own sort of peace and freedom” (#2)
  5. “You cannot pick and choose which aprts of her to love.” (#3)
  6. “She was the heir of ash and fire and would bow to no one.” (#3)
  7. “…And she would not be afraid” (#3)
  8. “Why do you cry, Fireheart? Because I am lost. And I do not know the way.” (#3)
  9. “It would not take a monster to destroy a monster- but light, light to drive out the darkness.” (#3)
  10. “you do not have the right to wish she were not what she is. The only thing you have a right to do is decide whether you are her enemy or her friend.” (#3)
  11. “If you’re a monster- I’m a monster.” (#4)
  12. “Then she smiled with every last shred of courage, of desperation, of hope for the glimmer of that glamours future.” (#4)
  13. “I spent centuries wandering the world, from empires to kingdoms to wastelands, never settling, never stopping—not for one moment. I was always looking toward the horizon, always wondering what waited across the next ocean, over the next mountain. But I think … I think that whole time, all those centuries, I was just looking for you.” (#4)
  14. “but she was her own champion now.” (#4)
  15. “The world will be saved and remade by the dreamers.” (#5)
  16. “A court that wouldn’t just change the world. It would start the world over.” (#5)
  17. “tell him thank you—for walking that dark path with me back to the light.” (#5)
  18. “had promised herself, months and months ago, that she would not pretend to be anything but what she was.” (#5)
  19. “There was no force in any world that could keep her contained” (#5)
  20. “No lady, beautiful or plain, young or old, deserved to be gawked” (#6)
  21. “you must enter where you fear to tread” (#6)
  22. “You do not yeild.” (#7)
  23. “She would not go quietly. She was not afraid.” (#7)
  24. “The choice of how our people’s future shall be shaped is yours, But I will tell you this: There is a better world out there. And I have seen it.” (#7)
  25. “Hers was not a story of darkness. This would not be the story. She would fold it into herself, this place, this fear, but it would not be the whole story. It would not be her story.” (#7)
  26. “But just remember that this fear of yours? It means you have something worth fighting for - something you care so greatly for that losing it is the worst thing you can imagine.” (#7)
  27. “She would endure it again, if asked. She would do it. Every brutal hour and bit of agony. And it would hurt, and she would scream, but she’d face it. Survive against it.” (#7)

tags: i havent sat down and read through a book like this in forever
summary:
Just finished reading Catwoman Soulstealer by Sarah J. Maas and I just... Wow
This book was so good. I started this morning and...
body:
Just finished reading Catwoman Soulstealer by Sarah J. Maas and I just… Wow

This book was so good. I started this morning and read it all the way through. Sarah’s writing style is so perfect and her romance is amazing 💙❤️

Aaaaah! I just love it so much! If you haven’t already read it you need to! Please!

reblog.comment:

trail.content:
Just finished reading Catwoman Soulstealer by Sarah J. Maas and I just… Wow

This book was so good. I started this morning and read it all the way through. Sarah’s writing style is so perfect and her romance is amazing 💙❤️

Aaaaah! I just love it so much! If you haven’t already read it you need to! Please!

summary:
@faenet event: alternate universes -> Hades and Persephone
He thinks he'll be remembered as the villain in the story. But I...
body:
@faenet event: alternate universes -> Hades and Persephone

He thinks he’ll be remembered as the villain in the story. But I forgot to tell him that the villain is usually the person who locks up the maiden and throws away the key. He was the one who let me out.
